title: Traditions of Edinburgh.
author: Chambers, Robert
snippet: Ramsay died in 17o7. An elderly female told a friend of mine that she remembered, when a girl living as an apprentice with a milliner in the Grassmarket, being sent to Ramsay Garden to assist in making dead-clothes for the poet. She could recall, however, no particulars of the scene, but the roses blooming in at the window of the death- chamber.
